channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11873] Hbase Version CLI enhancement
item.description:
Hbase Version CLI enhancements:

1) include source code checksum.
2) change "Subversion" to "Source code repository"

Existing implementation:

hadoop@localhost p4_wspaces]$ hbase version
2014-09-01 03:29:40,773 INFO [main] util.VersionInfo: HBase 0.98.1-hadoop2
2014-09-01 03:29:40,773 INFO [main] util.VersionInfo: Subversion <...>
2014-09-01 03:29:40,773 INFO [main] util.VersionInfo: Compiled by <...>

Expected implematation:

hadoop@localhost p4_wspaces]$ hbase version
2014-09-01 03:29:40,773 INFO [main] util.VersionInfo: HBase 0.98.1-hadoop2
2014-09-01 03:29:40,773 INFO [main] util.VersionInfo: Source code repository <...> <<< change "Subversion" to "Source code repository"
2014-09-01 03:29:40,773 INFO [main] util.VersionInfo: Compiled by <...>
2014-09-01 03:29:40,773 INFO [main] util.VersionInfo: From source with checksum eb1b9e8d63c302bed1168a7122d70 <<< include source code checksum

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This should be an easy patch to try – want to give try making a patch for this Guo Ruijing?

Patch addresses both the points.
Please review.

Nice idea. How long does it take calculating the md5? Your VersionInfo is not portable. Its md5sum on some systems and md5 on others.
Should probably show the checksum in the UI too.
Updated the patch as per the stack's comments.

We may ' find .| grep "src/main" | grep -e "\.java" -e "\.proto" '

1. source code may include hbase-common/hbase-client, hbase-thrift, etc
2. source code may include .proto.

Patch addressing Guo Ruijing's comment.
Checksum will be generated for all the .java and .proto files in hbase-* projects under source directory.

How long does it take calculating the md5?

It takes a second or two.

This message is automatically generated.

Your VersionInfo is not portable.

What about the above? What happens when I build on a mac say?

Looks like we need to fix our zombie checker or remove it. The expectation that we are only build running on a machine is no longer true. Zombie test is doing this:

ZOMBIE_TESTS_COUNT=`jps | grep surefirebooter | wc -l`

Thanks stack for taking a look into the patch.

What about the above? What happens when I build on a mac say?

This I have handled in the script like below.


which md5sum > /dev/null

if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then

  which md5 > /dev/null

  if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then

    srcChecksum="Unknown"

  else

    srcChecksum=`find hbase-*/src/main/ | grep -e "\.java" -e "\.proto" | LC_ALL=C sort | xargs md5 | md5 | cut -d ' ' -f 1`

  fi

else

  srcChecksum=`find hbase-*/src/main/ | grep -e "\.java" -e "\.proto" | LC_ALL=C sort | xargs md5sum | md5sum | cut -d ' ' -f 1`

fi

The first if command will check whether md5sum command exists, if it does then it will use md5sum to generate checksum. If not, then it will check the same for md5 command existence if it does then it will use md5 to generate the checksum else it will mark checksum as Unknown.
I hope you understand it.

P.S: Mac uses md5 command to generate checksum
Pushed to master and branch-1. Thanks for the patch Ashish. I tried it and seems to work nicely.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Calculates on startup checksum of running code. Emits in logs on startup and shows in UI.
